alert.note: Alert for Rensselaer; Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 26 at 12:45PM EDT until August 26 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Washington County in east central New York... Northeastern Rensselaer County in east central New York... Bennington County in southern Vermont... West central Windham County in southern Vermont... * Until 130 PM EDT. * At 1244 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hartford to near Hoosick Falls, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Bennington, Hoosick Falls, Arlington, Salem, Manchester, Shaftsbury, Dorset, Cambridge, Manchester Center, Hoosick, Porter, Lee, Pittstown, White Creek, North Bennington, Sunderland, Rupert, Woodford, Sandgate and Old Bennington. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
